items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise at the Pillings Lock river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible tonight, 31/10/2022.   Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high over the next couple of days.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 01/11/2022, or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise at the Whitewater Bridge river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible to begin between 04:00 and 06:00 tomorrow, 01/11/22.  Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads around Mansfield, the Sherwood Forest Caravan Park at Clipstone, Edwinstowe, Ollerton, Whitewater Lane at Whitewater Bridge and West Drayton.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high until 04:00 on 02/10/22.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated this evening, 31/10/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Wiske and tributaries to the River Swale

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Wiske, Brompton Beck, Cod Beck, North Beck, Willow Beck, Sun Beck, Winton Beck

items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise on the Brompton Beck, Cod Beck, River Wiske and Willow Beck due to rainfall expected overnight on Monday 31/10/2022. Flooding is possible at The River Wiske, Brompton Beck, Cod Beck, North Beck, Willow Beck, Sun Beck, Winton Beck on Monday evening 31/10/2022, and into Tuesday morning 01/11/2022. At Kirby Wiske, river levels are expected to rise later into Tuesday but are not expected to flood access roads at this time. Further rainfall over the coming days will mean river levels are likely to fluctuate. 
We will continue to monitor levels closely. This message will be updated by 10:00 PM on 31/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Swale, Gilling Beck, Skeeby Beck

items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise on the Arkle Beck, River Swale due to rainfall expected overnight on Monday 31/10/2022. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Arkle Beck, River Swale including low lying roads and footpaths overnight and into Tuesday morning 01/11/22. Further rainfall is forecast over the coming days and river levels will fluctuate. 
We will continue to monitor levels closely. This message will be updated by 10:00 PM on 31/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise on the River Rye Catchment due to rainfall expected overnight on Monday 31/10/2022. Areas most at risk include land around the River Rye and it's tributaries, including Ralsdale Beck, River Seph, Ledge Beck, Fangdale Beck, Prodale Beck, Ladhill Beck, Etton Gill, Borough Beck and Spittle Beck, including properties of Salton, Nunnington and Helmsley. In these areas, flooding is expected overnight and into Tuesday morning 01/11/2022. Further rainfall over the coming days will mean river levels are likely to fluctuate. 
We will continue to monitor levels closely. This message will be updated by 10:00 PM on 31/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise on the River Riccal due to rainfall expected overnight on Monday 31/10/2022. Areas most at risk include land around the River Riccal and it's tributaries including Bonfield Gill, Bogmire Gill, Ellerker Beck, Keld Spring Beck and Walmouth Beck, including properties to the West of Mill Street in Harome and properties along Howldale Lane in Beadlam. In these areas, flooding is expected overnight and into Tuesday morning 01/11/2022. Further rainfall over the coming days will mean river levels are likely to fluctuate.
We will continue to monitor levels closely. This message will be updated by 10:00 PM on 31/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise at the Sharnford river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible to begin after midnight tonight, 01/11/2022.  Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Sharnford, Croft, Littlethorpe, the Mill on the Soar car park and Falconry.   
Further heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high tomorrow morning, 01/11/2022.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 01/11/2022 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rothley Brook and Quorn Brook in Leicestershire
items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise at the Glenfield river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible to begin after midnight tonight, 01/11/2022.  Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including the Midlands Co-Op Store car parks at Glenfield and Anstey. Low-lying land and farmlands in the Glenfield, Anstey, Thurcaston, Rothley, Newtown Linford, Cropston, Swithland and Quorn areas.   
Further heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high tomorrow morning, 01/11/2022.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 01/11/2022 or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise at the Wedderburn Bridge river gauge as a result of forecast heavy rainfall this evening.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from this evening and overnight tonight. 31/10/22. We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Leadon. Locations that may be affected include Ledbury, Much Marcle, Staunton and Tibberton. Water could also be over the road at Upleadon Court.   
Further rainfall is expected this week. We expect river levels to remain high for a number of days. 
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking defences and clearing weed screens.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated by 09:00 on 01/11/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Middle River Mersey catchment including areas near Bramhall, Stockport, Sale, Altrincham and Urmston

floodArea.county: Cheshire East, Manchester, Salford, Stockport, Tameside, Trafford, Warrington

items.message: River levels will rise on the River Mersey due to heavy rainfall overnight. Flooding is possible at low lying land and roads around Micker, Cringle, Sinderland and Poynton Brooks and their tributaries from early morning on 01/11/2022. The forecast is mainly dry throughout the day tomorrow however, further rainfall is forecast tomorrow night. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 11:00 AM on 01/11/2022, or as the situation changes.
